TopicTitle: Lost the view of my vessel in the

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

KSP 1.0.2.842 here, on steam.

I have accepted a contract to make thermal measurment on Kerbin. Since this contract, some new points have appeared on my orbital map view (M key).

But since, my vessel, its orbit/trajectory have disappeared from my orbital map view. Without my orbit and trajectory, it is almost impossible to play and pilot my vessel.

I have restarted the game, and the situation is the same.

I have tried to change the focus, reset the view. No effect.

I have tried to cancel my contract. The ticks for temperature measurement are gone, but I still cannot see my orbit or trajectory.

I have reinstalled the game. Situation is the same.

Here is a screen capture : [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=437975119](http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=437975119)

Any advice or solution?

Sorry for my english. I presume I have made some grammar/syntax mistakes.

Best regards to all of you.

EDIT : Add one test

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-06T19:32:30Z" title="05/06/2015 07:32  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 6, 2015</time> by samovian**

Hello,

I have load an old save from before the 1.0. This save is not usable anymore due to the evolution of the carreer system, but when I go the orbital map view, I see my orbit/trajectory again.

The problem seems to come from the save.

Is my save broken? I hope not. I do not want to restart again (and again after almost each release)
You may find that your map has the filter for your vessel turned off, this can happen a lot with probes, mouse over the top edge of the map and you will see a number of vessel types.

You are totally right. I was'nt aware that the selection of what is visible in the space center could affect my orbital game view during the mission.

Problem solved! Thanks you sal\_vager!
